head.title: The Long and the Short of Campaigning

hedline.hl1: The Long and the Short of Campaigning

block.p: Jeff Greenfield's amusing ''Him. Them. Us. Vote.'' (Op-Ed, June 6), about presidential aspirants' names, calls to mind other aspects: the double vowel and alliteration.
There are the double vowels in Coolidge, Hoover and the two Roosevelts. And there is the alliterative Woodrow Wilson, Calvin Coolidge, Herbert Hoover and Ronald Reagan.
Jeff Greenfield's amusing ''Him. Them. Us. Vote.'' (Op-Ed, June 6), about presidential aspirants' names, calls to mind other aspects: the double vowel and alliteration.
There are the double vowels in Coolidge, Hoover and the two Roosevelts. And there is the alliterative Woodrow Wilson, Calvin Coolidge, Herbert Hoover and Ronald Reagan.
Does it help to get elected? The mind boggles.
NORMAN KIELL Long Beach, N.Y., June 6, 2000
